description:
Twenty-five years after Éclair and Lumière, (from the flagship Kiddy Grade series), rescued the galaxy from destruction's doorstep, the GTO (Galactic Trade Organization), created after the defeat of the GOTT (Galactic Organization of Trade and Tariffs), act on behalf of universal peace by combating criminal activity.

Their special ES division mirrored after the GOTT's ES (Encounter of Shadow-work) force, now includes publicly acknowledged ES member candidates. The series follows two such trainees, Ascoeur and Q-feuille, as they work their way to ES membership.

(Source: Wikipedia)

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

node.description:
__[Website](https://coorie.futureartist.net/) | [Profile (Peak A Soul)](https://www.peakasoul.net/coorie) | [Blog (JP)](https://rinocoorie.exblog.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/rino_CooRie)__

__Rino__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist and composer. She used to be a part of the two-piece unit [CooRie](https://anilist.co/staff/101323) alongside Naoyuki Osada between 2002 and 2003, which is when Osada formally left the unit. Rino would go on to continue the music unit under the same name, but now as a solo unit, and as the sole member. She mostly composes under the name CooRie, but will sometimes be credited under her own name instead.

_(Not to be confused with the voice actress [Rino](https://anilist.co/staff/189936))_

__[Website](http://goto.cute.or.jp)__

Gotou began his career as an animator at Atorie. After the closing of Atorie, he worked for other studios such as Project Team Muu and Fenx before going freelancer. He serves as character designer, animation director and animator on countless anime series and contributes to a monthly comic strip to Newtype magazine.

He has been an animator since he graduated from high school at 18. Unlike most other animators Gotou had never gone to an art school. He became interested in animation after seeing an advertisement in an animation magazine saying that animators were needed. Without having any connections within the industry he went on and joined Atelier Giga and studied there for a year under [Akihiko Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/103299/) before marking his debut as animator on [Mister Ajikko](https://anilist.co/anime/3437/).

In 1988 Studio Atelier declared bancrupcy and he went to Project Team Muu, which later became Phoenix Entertainment. His first work there was as animator on Anime Sanjushi. When working on the Yuusha Saga, he met Ishida Atsuko on Densetsu no Yuusha Da Garn, who influenced Gotou in his character design, particularly the design of the eyes. Together with the experience from training under Yamashita Akihiko this influence resulted in Gotou's so called "gocky picture" later.

He made his debut as character designer on Choujin Densetsu Urotsukidouji 4 and his debut as series director on Kiddy Grade.

Married to [Megumi Kadonosono](https://anilist.co/staff/100963/).

(Source: Anidb)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/satojumichi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐藤順一)

Junichi Satou is a Japanese anime director, best known for working on shoujo-based anime and in the magical girl genre. He was formerly associated with [TYO Animations](https://anilist.co/studio/333/), formerly known as [Hal Film Maker](https://anilist.co/studio/34/).

Satou’s first major work was directing the first, and a portion of the second season of [Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/530/) for [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/), after which he handed the position over to [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/), although he continued to storyboard and direct episodes for the later seasons. Satou later went on to co-direct [Ojamajo Doremi](https://anilist.co/anime/350/) alongside [Takuya Igarashi](https://anilist.co/staff/105087/), as well as the critically acclaimed [Princess Tutu](https://anilist.co/anime/721/). Satou served as chief director for long-runner [Sgt. Frog](https://anilist.co/anime/516/), and in recent years has become more known for his iyashikei works such as [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477/) and [Tamayura](https://anilist.co/anime/9055/).

He's married to [Yasuno Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/144094/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Gender:__ Female
__Doujin Circles:__ MIKAN-HONPO, Ask (with Aino Serin)

[Official Website](http://mekapen.blog116.fc2.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/higayukari) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=7539451)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/門之園恵美)

Married to fellow animator [Keiji Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/97307/).
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/きむらひでふみ)
[Website](https://www.peakasoul.net/yozuca) | [Blog](https://blog.excite.co.jp/yozublog/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yozuca_astrsk)
[Website](https://www.peakasoul.net/yozuca) | [Blog](https://blog.excite.co.jp/yozublog/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yozuca_astrsk)

[Official Website ](http://www.ariamusic.co.jp/) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/agematsu)

Noriyasu Agematsu is the founding member of the musical group Elements Garden.

Along with his fellow Elements Garden members, he is the composer and arranger for the BanG Dream! franchise, including overseeing music production for its anime.

[Official Website](https://aya-uchida.net) | [Website](https://columbia.jp/uchidaaya/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/ichigoshiroppu/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aya_uchida) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aya_Uchida) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%86%85%E7%94%B0%E5%BD%A9)

She is a Japanese voice actress and singer affiliated with JTB Entertainment. She also a member of famous media franchise "Love Live!".

__Non-anime roles:__
- Quency - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)

__Hometown:__ Kitami, Hokkaido, Japan

[Official blog](https://ameblo.jp/c-kitaoka/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/chiharu_kitaoka)

Kitaoka made her voice acting debut in [Kiddy Girl-and](https://anilist.co/anime/3349/) under the stage name Aya Gouda. She went on to use that name until she left the Production Ace agency in September 2012.

On March 27, 2016, she announced her marriage and her retirement from voice acting in a blog post. She is currently a voice acting instructor at Sapporo Broadcasting Arts College.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dreaming_wave) | [Blog](https://yumemon.com/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/64664693)

Yamamoto's interest in working in the anime industry piqued in high school after realizing how noticeable the difference in episodes were depending on the episode director in charge. One of his favourites shows included [Seisenshi Dunbine](https://anilist.co/anime/929/).

In the late '80s, he joined [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/) as a production assistant after finding out that it's how many of the studio's directors started off. There he met and studied under [Shuuji Iuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/115833/) on his shows [Madou King Granzort](https://anilist.co/anime/2818/) and [Mashin Eiyuuden Wataru](https://anilist.co/anime/4807/). Then after having gone freelance he got his first shot as a director as one of the three unit directors on Iuchi's [Ranma ½ film](https://anilist.co/anime/418/) in 1991.

In 2001, Yamamoto made his debut as a series director on [Shiawase Sou no Okojo-san](https://anilist.co/anime/2934/), soon after which he worked as the first director of the long-running [Keroro Gunsou](https://anilist.co/anime/516/). In 2006 he directed the well-received [NHK ni Youkoso!](https://anilist.co/anime/1210/)

More recent directorial works of his include [Yama no Susume](https://anilist.co/anime/14355/) and [Shounen Maid](https://anilist.co/anime/21321/).

__[Profile (Peak A Soul)](https://www.peakasoul.net/anze)__

__Hijiri Anze__ is a Japanese pianist, lyricist, composer and arranger. She was a co-composer of music for the game Resident Evil Code: Veronica.
_Note: Not to be confused with [Noritaka Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/144481/)._

__[Website](https://akihata.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akihata_jp) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/akihata.jp/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/AKIHATAjp)__

__Aki Hata__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of the music production team [Q-MHz](https://anilist.co/staff/156926/QMHz).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/145049847)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Tastufumi_Itoh) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/伊藤達文)

While still in Morioka, he and three of his friends produced a short anime film titled Bakuhatsu Choujin Kanada Man (爆発超人・金田マン), which was inspired by renown animator [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/). The film was screened at an amateur film festival in 1985 and subsequently featured in the anime magazine Animage.

In 2008, he married fellow animator [Mariko Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/120064/), and changed his name to Itou.

Passed away from a brain hemorrhage on May 23, 2020.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Tastufumi_Itoh) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/伊藤達文)

While still in Morioka, he and three of his friends produced a short anime film titled Bakuhatsu Choujin Kanada Man (爆発超人・金田マン), which was inspired by renown animator [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/). The film was screened at an amateur film festival in 1985 and subsequently featured in the anime magazine Animage.

In 2008, he married fellow animator [Mariko Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/120064/), and changed his name to Itou.

Passed away from a brain hemorrhage on May 23, 2020.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [scriptwriter](https://anilist.co/staff/119169/)._
